    val = [Image(opacity=0, sizex=(- 999999999)), Image(x=0, opacity=1.0, sizex=1000000000, sizey=500.5), Image()]
    res = validator.validate_coerce(val)
    res_present = validator.present(res)
    assert isinstance(res, list)
    assert isinstance(res_present, tuple)
    assert isinstance(res_present[0], Image)
    assert (res_present[0].opacity == 0)
    assert (res_present[0].sizex == (- 999999999))
    assert (res_present[0].x is None)
    assert isinstance(res_present[1], Image)
    assert (res_present[1].opacity == 1.0)
    assert (res_present[1].sizex == 1000000000)
    assert (res_present[1].x == 0)
    assert (res_present[1].sizey == 500.5)
    assert isinstance(res_present[2], Image)
    assert (res_present[2].opacity is None)
    assert (res_present[2].sizex is None)
    assert (res_present[2].x is None)
    assert (res_present[2].sizey is None)

    val = [dict(opacity='', x=(- 999999), sizex=0, sizey=22), dict(x=0, bogus={'a': 0}, sizey=0, opacity=(- 1)), dict(x=1.5, sizex='invalidsizex', opacity=None)]

    assert ([el.to_plotly_json() for el in res] == expected)

def test_deepcopy_figure_subplots(fig_subplots):
    fig_copied = copy.deepcopy(fig_subplots)
    assert (fig_copied.to_dict() == fig_subplots.to_dict())
    assert (fig_subplots._grid_ref == fig_copied._grid_ref)
    assert (fig_subplots._grid_str == fig_copied._grid_str)

    fig1.set_subplots(1, 2)

@pytest.mark.parametrize('pandas_fn,px_fn', [((lambda df: df.plot()), px.line), ((lambda df: df.plot.scatter('A', 'B')), (lambda df: px.scatter(df, 'A', 'B'))), ((lambda df: df.plot.line()), px.line), ((lambda df: df.plot.area()), px.area), ((lambda df: df.plot.bar()), px.bar), ((lambda df: df.plot.barh()), (lambda df: px.bar(df, orientation='h'))), ((lambda df: df.plot.box()), px.box), ((lambda df: df.plot.hist()), px.histogram), ((lambda df: df.boxplot()), px.box), ((lambda df: df.hist()), px.histogram), ((lambda df: df['A'].hist()), (lambda df: px.histogram(df['A']))), ((lambda df: df.plot(kind='line')), px.line), ((lambda df: df.plot(kind='area')), px.area), ((lambda df: df.plot(kind='bar')), px.bar), ((lambda df: df.plot(kind='box')), px.box), ((lambda df: df.plot(kind='hist')), px.histogram), ((lambda df: df.plot(kind='histogram')), px.histogram), ((lambda df: df.plot(kind='violin')), px.violin), ((lambda df: df.plot(kind='strip')), px.strip), ((lambda df: df.plot(kind='funnel')), px.funnel), ((lambda df: df.plot(kind='density_contour')), px.density_contour), ((lambda df: df.plot(kind='density_heatmap')), px.density_heatmap), ((lambda df: df.plot(kind='imshow')), px.imshow)])
def test_pandas_equiv(pandas_fn, px_fn):
    pd.options.plotting.backend = 'plotly'
    df = pd.DataFrame({'A': np.random.uniform((- 1000), 1000, size=200), 'B': np.random.randint((- 5000), 5000, size=200), 'C': np.random.randn(200), 'D': np.linspace(0, 1, 200), 'E': (((([''] * 50) + (['foobar'] * 50)) + (['baz'] * 50)) + (['qux'] * 50))}).reset_index(drop=True)
    df.loc[(10:15, 'A')] = np.nan
    df.loc[(20:25, 'E')] = None
    numeric_cols = ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D']
    fn_name_str = getattr(px_fn, '__name__', str(px_fn))
    px_requires_numeric_only = ['line', 'area', 'bar', 'box', 'histogram', '<lambda>', 'strip', 'violin', 'funnel', 'density_contour', 'density_heatmap']
    if (fn_name_str in px_requires_numeric_only):
        df_numeric = df[numeric_cols]
        fig1 = pandas_fn(df_numeric)
        fig2 = px_fn(df_numeric)
        assert (fig1 == fig2)
    elif (fn_name_str == 'imshow'):
        fig1 = pandas_fn(df)
        fig2 = px_fn(df)
        assert (type(fig1) == type(fig2))
    else:
        fig1 = pandas_fn(df)
        fig2 = px_fn(df)
        assert (fig1 == fig2)

def test_write_html():
    'Verify that various methods for producing HTML have equivalent results.\n\n    The results will not be identical because the div id is pseudorandom. Thus\n    we compare the results after replacing the div id.\n\n    We test the results of\n    - pio.to_html\n    - pio.write_html with a StringIO buffer\n    - pio.write_html with a mock pathlib Path\n    - pio.write_html with a mock file descriptor\n    '
    html = pio.to_html(fig)
    sio = StringIO()
    pio.write_html(fig, sio)
    sio.seek(0)
    sio_html = sio.read()
    assert (replace_div_id(html) == replace_div_id(sio_html))
    mock_pathlib_path = Mock(spec=Path)
    pio.write_html(fig, mock_pathlib_path)
    mock_pathlib_path.write_text.assert_called_once()
    pl_html = mock_pathlib_path.write_text.call_args[0][0]
    assert (replace_div_id(html) == replace_div_id(pl_html))
    mock_file_descriptor = Mock()
    del mock_file_descriptor.write_bytes
    pio.write_html(fig, mock_file_descriptor)
    mock_file_descriptor.write.assert_called_once()
    (fd_html,) = mock_file_descriptor.write.call_args[0]
    assert (replace_div_id(html) == replace_div_id(fd_html))

def test_supplied_yref_on_multi_plot_subplot():
    'test multiple subploted figure object with subplots.make_subplots with edge specs'
    fig = make_subplots(rows=2, cols=2, shared_yaxes=True, specs=[[{'secondary_y': True}, {'secondary_y': True}], [None, {'type': 'polar'}]])
    fig.add_trace(go.Scatter(x=[(- 1000000.0), 0, 1000000.0], y=[0, 0, 0]), row=1, col=1)
    fig.add_trace(go.Scatter(x=[0, 0, 0], y=[(- 99999), 0, 99999], yaxis='y2'), row=1, col=1, secondary_y=True)
    fig.add_trace(go.Scatter(x=[None, 1, None], y=[(- 1), 0, 1]), row=1, col=2)
    fig.add_trace(go.Scatter(x=[100.0, (- 100.0)], y=[1e-09, (- 1e-09)], yaxis='y2'), row=1, col=2, secondary_y=True)
    fig.add_hline(y=(- 10), row=1, col=1, secondary_y=True)
    fig.add_hline(y=1e-05, row=1, col=2, secondary_y=True)
    assert (fig.layout['shapes'][0]['yref'] == 'y2')
    assert (fig.layout['shapes'][0]['xref'] == 'x domain')
    assert (fig.layout['shapes'][1]['yref'] == 'y4')
    assert (fig.layout['shapes'][1]['xref'] == 'x2 domain')

    tr = list(fig.select_traces(selector=2))
    assert (len(tr) == 1)
    assert (tr[0].y[0] == '???')
    _ = list(fig.select_traces(selector=(- 6)))[0]
    tr = list(fig.select_traces(selector=0))
    assert (tr[0].y[1] == 0)
    tr = list(fig.select_traces(selector=(- 1)))[0]
    assert (tr.y[1] == 20)
    tr = list(fig.select_traces(selector=0, row=2, col=3))[0]
    assert (tr.y[1] == 0)

def test_figure_json_encoding(self):
    df = pd.DataFrame(columns=['Value'], data=[0, (- 1), 10000000000.0, 3.14159])
    s1 = Scatter3d(x=[0, (- 999), 9999999999], y=np.array([0.0, (- 999.99), np_nan(), dt(2024, 1, 1)]), z=['', 'Z', dt(2024, 1, 1), dt(2024, 1, 1, 23, 59, 59, 999999)])
    s2 = Scatter(x=df['Value'])
    data = Data([s1, s2])
    figure = Figure(data=data)
    js1 = _json.dumps(s1, cls=utils.PlotlyJSONEncoder, sort_keys=True)
    js2 = _json.dumps(s2, cls=utils.PlotlyJSONEncoder, sort_keys=True)
    assert (js1 == '{"type": "scatter3d", "x": [0, -999, 9999999999], "y": [0.0, -999.99, null, "2024-01-01T00:00:00"], "z": ["", "Z", "2024-01-01T00:00:00", "2024-01-01T23:59:59.999999"]}')
    assert (js2 == '{"type": "scatter", "x": [0.0, -1.0, 10000000000.0, 3.14159]}')
    _json.dumps(data, cls=utils.PlotlyJSONEncoder, sort_keys=True)
    _json.dumps(figure, cls=utils.PlotlyJSONEncoder, sort_keys=True)
    np_array = np.array([0.0, (- 999.99), np_nan(), dt(2024, 1, 1)])
    y_orig = np.array([0.0, (- 999.99), np_nan(), dt(2024, 1, 1)])
    for k in range(len(np_array)):
        if (k == 2):
            assert (np.isnan(y_orig[k]) and np.isnan(np_array[k]))
        else:
            assert (y_orig[k] == np_array[k])
    assert (set(data[0]['z']) == set(['', 'Z', dt(2024, 1, 1), dt(2024, 1, 1, 23, 59, 59, 999999)]))

def test_color_validator_numeric(color_validator, numeric_xarray):
    res = color_validator.validate_coerce(numeric_xarray)
    assert isinstance(res, np.ndarray)
    assert (res.dtype == numeric_xarray.dtype)
    np.testing.assert_array_equal(res, numeric_xarray)
